#summary Development Timeline

This page is geared towards developers and power-users. For general coverage of releases, see the ArbotixReleases page.

For versions 1.1 and beyond, we will use a 3 distribution method:
 * software-core-X
 * software-pypose-X
 * software-robocontroller-X

= Improvement and Developments Outline =

 * Core 1.1 (January 2010)
   * new libraries: Encoders (actually part of roboControllerLib) - <font color="#009933">_done_</font>
   * new examples: a rover with closed loop feedback
   * AX-S1 support macros - <font color="#FF0000">_in progress_</font>

 * PyPose V1.1 Beta 1 (January 3, 2010)
   * First version of NUKE - the Nearly Universal Kinematics Engine
       # Full IK interface (limits, neutrals, mapping, params) - <font color="#FF0000">_in progress_</font>
       # Supports Lizard 3DOF, 4/6 legs - <font color="#009933">_done_</font>
       # Basic gaits and tools, stance generator - <font color="#009933">_done_</font>
 
 * PyPose V1.1 Beta 2 (January 2010)
   * Support for Mammal 3DOF - <font color="#FF0000">_in progress_</font>
   * Re-ordered default servo mapping.
   * Relax servos at the beginning of neutral/limit captures
   * Re-arranged some buttons (test drive)
   * Messages after finishing neutral capture

  * PyPose V1.2 (Early 2010)
    * Gait parser, geometric gait support
    * New Port Open dialog, with selection of driver
    * Servo Terminal complete

  * PyPose V1.3 (?)

= Revision History =

 * Version 1.0c (11-29-09, r365)
   * Fixed issues with Delta-T under Pose Editor

 * Version 1.0b (11-14-09, r351)
   * Port drivers merged
   * Delta-T added to Pose Editor "set" command
   * Many libraries moved to [http://robocontroller.googlecode.com RoboControllerLib]

 * Version 1.0a (10-18-09, r329)
   * Port detection overhauled for MacOSX users. 
   * Port errors are actually now detected (arbotix.py pushes errors higher).
   * Fixed blank transition error.
   * Fixed timeout issues. 

 * Release Candidate 1a (10/17/09)
   * Fixed save/load bug

   * Repaired new project dialog.
